member.name: T:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.CallGraph.CallGraphRootMarksProviderBase
member.summary: MarksProvider is responsible for creating root marks in call graph. After that, SWA will take `Propagator` and propagate this marks in call graph. The base solution to implement your own marksProvider is inherit it from CallGraphRootMarksProviderBase

member.name: P:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.CallGraph.CallGraphRootMarksProviderBase.Enabled
member.summary: Is current marksProvider enabled for current solution

member.name: P:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.CallGraph.CallGraphRootMarksProviderBase.Propagator
member.summary: Get propagator which will be responsible for propagation mark in call graph

member.name: M:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.CallGraph.CallGraphRootMarksProviderBase.GetRootMarksFromNode(JetBrains.ReSharper.Psi.Tree.ITreeNode,JetBrains.ReSharper.Psi.IDeclaredElement)
member.summary: This function is called for each node inside function.
member.returns: Return list of root marks from current node

member.name: M:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.CallGraph.CallGraphRootMarksProviderBase.GetBanMarksFromNode(JetBrains.ReSharper.Psi.Tree.ITreeNode,JetBrains.ReSharper.Psi.IDeclaredElement)
member.summary: This function is called for each node inside function.
member.returns: Return list of ban marks from current node

member.name: T:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.CallGraph.ICallGraphEdgeProvider
member.summary: Creates edges in call graph, e.g: UnityEngine has Invoke(string) method, which Invokes method by name. Implementation of this class could be used to create implicit edge from caller to implicitly invoked function

member.name: M:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.CallGraph.ICallGraphEdgeProvider.FindEdges(JetBrains.ReSharper.Psi.Tree.ITreeNode,JetBrains.ReSharper.Psi.IDeclaredElement,JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.CallGraph.ICallGraphEdgeConsumer)
member.summary: This method is used to create edges in call graph. ATTENTION: !!!some edges CANNOT be represented by IDeclaredElement!!! so the resulting list of edges DOES NOT include all possible edges, some of them are placed directly to the provided CallGraphDataElement, be careful!!!

member.name: T:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.CallGraph.ICallGraphPropagator
member.summary: ICallGraphPropagator is responsible for propagation root marks in call graph. Root marks in call graph are created by CallGraphRootMarksProviderBase For each call graph modification corresponding method will be called. Note: all changes in graph appears in following order 1. remove edges 2. remove root marks 3. remove ban marks 4. remove vertices 5. add vertices 6. add ban marks 7. add root marks 8. add edges
This method is called before edge will be removed. Implementation should be O(1)
member.param: Start vertex of edge which will be removed
End vertex of edge which will be removed

member.summary: This method is called before vertex will be unmarked. Implementation should be O(1)
This method is called before vertex will be permitted. Implementation should be O(1)
This method is called before vertex will be removed. Implementation should be O(1)
This method is called after new vertex was added. Implementation should be O(1)
member.param: Vertex which was added to graph

member.summary: This method is called after vertex was banned. Implementation should be O(1)
This method is called after vertex was marked. Implementation should be O(1)
This method is called after new edge was added. Implementation should be O(1)
member.param: Start vertex of edge which was added
End vertex of edge which was added

member.summary: Return mark of queried vertex. Implementation should be O(1)
Return mark of queried vertex. Implementation should be interruptible

member.name: M:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.CallGraph.ICallGraphPropagator.Clear
member.summary: Clear internal state

member.summary: This component suppress SWA on some NuGet activities

member.name: M:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.NuGet.NuGetSolutionAnalysisSuppressor.SuppressSwaWhenContentFileStorageIsBusy
member.summary: Typically, NuGetContentFileStorage is busy when we discovered some new NuGet packages (in some cases, it's busy "just in case", but we will optimize it later). During the NuGetContentFileStorage processing session, SWA should be disabled because some projects may contain content files from NuGet packages which should be ignored by SWA, but we don't know which files are content files yet.
